intro: Genosiris eriostephana, commonly known as the purple coneflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It features upright stems with lance-shaped leaves that are hairy on the underside. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of purple and pink, typically blooming from June to September. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Its botanical characteristics make it a popular choice for gardeners seeking both ornamental and ecological value.
